Package edu.connect4

Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.connect4.Board
  • public class Board
extends java.lang.Object
    The Board class represents a board in the Connect 4 game board.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Board()
      Constructor for the Board class.

    • Method Summary

      Modifier and Type Method Description
      boolean checkWin​(Player player)
      Checks whether the specified player has won the game by forming a line of 4 consecutive disks of their designated color on the board.
      java.lang.String[][] getGrid()
      A getter returns the board's grid for rendering
      boolean isBoardFull()
      Checks if the board is full, meaning there are no more open spots for disks on the board.
      boolean makeMove​(Player player, int column)
      Makes a move for the player by dropping their disk into the specified column.
      void resetBoard()
      Resets the game board to its initial state with all cells set to null.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Board

        public Board()
        Constructor for the Board class. Initializes the board with null values and the disk count per column.

    • Method Detail

      • getGrid

        public java.lang.String[][] getGrid()
        A getter returns the board's grid for rendering
        Returns:
        the grid field

      • makeMove

        public boolean makeMove​(Player player,
                        int column)
        Makes a move for the player by dropping their disk into the specified column.
        Parameters:
        player - The player making the move.
        column - The column number of the grid where the disk is to be dropped.
        Returns:
        true if the move was a success, else false if the given column is full or out of bounds.

      • checkWin

        public boolean checkWin​(Player player)
        Checks whether the specified player has won the game by forming a line of 4 consecutive disks of their designated color on the board. The line can be vertical, horizontal, or diagonal.
        Parameters:
        player - The player whose winning condition is being checked.
        Returns:
        true if the player has successfully connected 4 disks in a row, else returns false.

      • resetBoard

        public void resetBoard()
        Resets the game board to its initial state with all cells set to null. Also resets the disk count for each column.

      • isBoardFull

        public boolean isBoardFull()
        Checks if the board is full, meaning there are no more open spots for disks on the board.
        Returns:
        true if the board is full, else false.
